markdownRemark.html:
When to use: A drop-down menu pops up for the user to choose an operation to replace the native selector, or when a more elegant multiple selector is needed.

The difference between the drop-down selection box of Pro Select and the basic component is that Pro refines the concept of quick code in the middle and Taiwan business components and integrates it into the Select component. Usually we call Pro Select a value set or quick code.

The fast code value set data source is maintained at the back end. When the front end is used, the corresponding lookupCode field can be configured to request the associated fast code data source and cache it. The fast code is generally suitable for scenarios where the amount of data is not large.

Next, let's practice how to use the value set code to quickly and efficiently use the Select component in business development.

Quick code value list

Here we need to refer to demo -value list code.

View the DataSet field configuration:

{
  name:'sex',
  type:'string',
  lookupCode:'HR.EMPLOYEE_GENDER'
},

In the Pro component, the corresponding field will be rendered as Select in the component according to type: string + lookupCode. At this time, the data source of the drop-down comes from the back-end request interface corresponding to lookupCode. For example, the above field configuration, component library built-in interface rules generate url:'/common/code/HR.EMPLOYEE_GENDER/'.

Of course, when the back-end interface does not conform to the built-in rules of the component, you can use the lookupAxiosConfig property to modify the configuration to support global configuration.

Attribute name Description Type
lookupAxiosConfig The configuration or hook of the value list request, see AxiosRequestConfig for details. The default url in the configuration is lookupUrl, and the method is post. AxiosRequestConfig | ({ dataSet: DataSet, record: Record, params?: any, lookupCode: string }) => AxiosRequestConfig

Select The default option value corresponds to the value & meaning in the data source object. For example, the above data source may be:

[
        {
            "objectVersionNumber": 1,
            "codeId": 10001,
            "codeValueId": 10027,
            "description": "女性",
            "meaning": "女",
            "value": "F",
            "orderSeq": 10,
            "tag": null,
            "enabledFlag": "Y",
            "parentCodeValueId": null,
            "parentCodeValue": null,
            "parentCodeValueMeaning": null
        },
        {
            "objectVersionNumber": 1,
            "codeId": 10001,
            "codeValueId": 10028,
            "description": "男性",
            "meaning": "男",
            "value": "M",
            "orderSeq": 20,
            "tag": null,
            "enabledFlag": "Y",
            "parentCodeValueId": null,
            "parentCodeValue": null,
            "parentCodeValueMeaning": null
        }
]

Then when the Select option "male" is selected, the corresponding value is "M". If the required display field is not meaning, it can be modified through textField; the value field is through valueField.

Attribute name Description Type Default value
textField The text field of the value list string meaning
valueField The value field of the value list string value

E.g:

{
   name:'sex',
   type:'string',
   textField:'description',
   valueField:'codeId',
   lookupCode:'HR.EMPLOYEE_GENDER'
},

The rendering options and selected values will change accordingly.

Binding data source

Here we need to refer to demo -Binding Data Source&Data source option.

In the practice of the previous chapters, we have used data source selection, using DataSet as a drop-down data source.

For example, the data source management of mailbox suffix, the management of Form gender and language. In this way, the basic rendering traversal of managing the fast code data source based on the DataSet is much more convenient, and it is also conducive to the dynamic data processing of more complex scenes.

To understand the concept of fast code, after reviewing the previous practice, we will not introduce it in detail here.

Cascading

Here we need to refer to demo -Select Options-Cascade。

Cascading effect: determines the presentation content in the child selection according to the parent selection content.

The key point to realize cascading: the cascademap configuration Association at the fields.props level is correct.

Attribute name Description Type
cascadeMap Cascade parameter mapping for quick code and LOV query, For example: cascadeMap: { parentCodeValue: "city" }，Where "city" is the name of other fields of the current data source, and parentcodevalue is the query parameter of fast code and lov. object

First, take the Select component as an example to see the cascading effect:

To view the dataset field configuration:

{
  name: 'sheng',
  label: '省',
  lookupCode: 'SHENG',
  valueField: 'codeValueId',
  defaultValue: '10206',
},
{
  name: 'shi',
  type: 'number',
  valueField: 'codeValueId',
  label: '市',
  lookupCode: 'SHI',
  cascadeMap: { parentCodeValueId: 'sheng' },
},

Understanding of cascademap parameter: it can be understood that after getting the data from the child field, a filtering operation is performed to display the data that meets the query parameters; cascadeMap:{ x: "y" }, x is the key of the key value pair existing in the back-end return data, and y is the name of the cascading parent field (here "Sheng").

Full backend data corresponding to demo

Interface address of mock data

To view the field configuration in the backend data:

// Parent
const province = {
  rows: [
    {
      codeValueId: 10206, // The codeValueId that matches when the parent is selected 
      meaning: '北京',
      value: 'BJ',
      ...
    },
    {
      codeValueId: 10207,
      meaning: '上海',
      value: 'SH',
      ...
    },
  ],
};
// Son
const city = {
  rows: [
    {
      codeValueId: 10204,
      meaning: '青浦区',
      value: 'QP',
      parentCodeValueId: 10207, // The parent selects the corresponding ID information and filters it as a query parameter
      parentCodeValue: 'SH', // The query criteria here can be understood as: select the child data that meets the codevalueid selected by the parent that meets the parentcodeid === selected for display
      ...
    },
    {
      codeValueId: 10205,
      meaning: '徐汇区',
      value: 'XH',
      parentCodeValueId: 10207,
      parentCodeValue: 'SH',
      ...
    },
    {
      codeValueId: 10208,
      meaning: '海定区',
      value: 'HD',
      parentCodeValueId: 10206,
      parentCodeValue: 'BJ',
      ...
    },
    {
      codeValueId: 10209,
      meaning: '朝阳区',
      value: 'CY',
      parentCodeValueId: 10206,
      parentCodeValue: 'BJ',
      ...
    },
  ],
};

When set multiple then input field too long

When set multiple, input field is too long, you can use maxTagCount set the maximum number of displays. Also can set style witdh.

<Select
  dataSet={this.ds}
  name="lov2"
  maxTagCount={2}
  maxTagTextLength={3}
  maxTagPlaceholder={(restValues) => `+${restValues.length}...`}
  style={{ width: '3rem' }}
/>

Except Select component, components that inherit from the FormField abstract form control have this property when multiple is set, such as Lov.

Quick code related methods

Quick code is an extremely frequently used component in normal work development. Therefore, there are many related methods and attributes, mainly related to the following.

Field props

Attribute name Description Type
textField The text field of the list of values string
valueField Value field of the value list string
lovPara LOV or Lookup query parameter object object
lookupCode Value list code string
lookupUrl Value list request address string | (code) => string
lookupAxiosConfig Value list request configuration or return configuration hook, see AxiosRequestConfig for details. The default url in the configuration is lookupUrl, and the method is post. AxiosRequestConfig| ({ dataSet, record, params, lookupCode }) => AxiosRequestConfig
cascadeMap Cascade parameter mapping for quick code and LOV query, See details Cascading. object
options The menu data set of the drop-down box component DataSet

Field Methods

Attribute name Description Type Default value
getText(lookupValue) Get lookup description based on lookup value lookupValue- lookup value, default this field value string
getLookupData(lookupValue) Get the lookup data object according to the lookup value lookupValue- lookup value, the default value of this field object
fetchLookup() Request lookup data, if there is a cache, return the cached data directly. Promise<object[]>

Configure Global configuration

Attribute name Description Type Default value
lookupCache lookup cache configuration. maxAge- Cache duration max- Maximum number of caches object { maxAge: 1000 _ 60 _ 10, max: 100 }
lookupUrl lookup address or return address hook string | ((code: string) => string) code => /common/code/${code}/
lookupAxiosConfig The configuration or hook of the value list request, see AxiosRequestConfig for details. The default url in the configuration is lookupUrl, and the method is post. AxiosRequestConfig | ({ dataSet: DataSet, record: Record, params?: any, lookupCode: string }) => AxiosRequestConfig
lookupBatchAxiosConfig Returns the lookup batch query configuration hook, see AxiosRequestConfig for details. (codes: string[]) => AxiosRequestConfig

Select API

Attribute name Description Type
options Drop-down box option data source (you need to process parameters after use, etc.) DataSet
noCache Automatically re-query when pull-down, do not cache pull-down data source boolean

In the next chapter, we will introduce the value set that supports large data magnitude-LOV.
